name: sodium bicarbonate, to generic market for neutralising agent | neutralising agent, sodium hydroxide-equivalent | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29869/documentation

This is a linking activity which links the product sodium bicarbonate to the generic market for neutralising agents. All chemicals that enter this market provide the function of neutralising agents.

Activity starting with the reception of sodium bicarbonate

Activity ends with the proper conversion of sodium bicarboante to neutralising agent in NaOH-equivalents.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: For  neutralisation purposes, it is considered that 1 mole of NaHCO3 can substitute 1 mole of NaOH for neutralisation purposes. The molar mass if NaHCO3 is 84.0066 g/mol, the molar mass of NaOH is 39.997.
